content.question: Which of the following limits is equal to <math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 5, of, the square root of 1 plus, x to the fourth power, end root, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, the square root of 1 plus, open parenthesis, the fraction k over n, close parenthesis, to the fourth power, end root, close parenthesis, times the fraction 1 over n " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, the square root of 1 plus, open parenthesis, the fraction 3 k over n, close parenthesis, to the fourth power, end root, close parenthesis, times the fraction 3 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, the square root of 1 plus, open parenthesis, 2 plus the fraction k over n, close parenthesis, to the fourth power, end root, close parenthesis, times the fraction 1 over n " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, the square root of 1 plus, open parenthesis, 2 plus the fraction 3 k over n, close parenthesis, to the fourth power, end root, close parenthesis, times the fraction 3 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the limit as n approaches infinity, of, the sum, from k equals 1, to n, of, open parenthesis, the square root of 1 plus, open parenthesis, 2 plus the fraction 3 k over n, close parenthesis, to the fourth power, end root, close parenthesis, times the fraction 3 over n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi><mo>→</mo><mi>∞</mi></mrow></munder><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><munderover><mrow><mo>∑</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>k</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></munderover></mrow></mstyle><mo>(</mo><mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
